ygData.subject: RE: [cantera] How to install Cantera?

Rahul, 

Sure it runs under Windows. You need to use Cantera within some other
environment - currently you can use it in MATLAB, Python
(www.python.org), Fortran 90, or C++. The easiest to learn are the
MATLAB and Python interfaces.

Just go to www.cantera.org, select 'download', and go to the directory
you want (e.g, 'matlab'). Get the file, unpack it, and read the
installation instructions there.

Dave



-----Original Message-----
From: rahul prakash nabar [mailto:rpnabar@...] 
Sent: Wednesday, September 25, 2002 9:04 AM
To: cantera@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [cantera] How to install Cantera?


Hi,

I am a student of Chemical engineering and have visited the 
Cantera website.

I wanted to know if Cantera runs on a Windows platform? Is it a 
free running package or a library of subroutines to be called 
under some other environment?

Could anyone tell me which files to download to get it running?. 
The relevent help link for installation does not seem to be active 
on the website.

Thanks in advance.

-Rahul
